question.text: Two particles <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are located at points <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>10</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></math> in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi></math> plane. They start moving simultaneously at the time <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> with constant velocities <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mover><mi>V</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mover><mi>V</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>, respectively. The time when they are closest to each other is found to be <math><mrow><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></math> second. Find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>K</mi></math>. All distances are given in meter.

solution.text:
As observed by B motion of A is along AM and BM is the shortest distance between them. Relative displacement of A w.r.t to B is AM=ABcos⁡30o



V→AB=5i^+53j^

Time taken t=S→ABV→AB=AMVAB=103cos⁡30o10

=1.5 s
